noncopyable Class Reference

#include <cobject.h>

Inheritance diagram for noncopyable:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Utility class, to make it impossible to call the operator= and copy constructor of any class derived from it.

NOTE: dup() must be redefined as {copyNotSupported(); return NULL;} in classes directly subclassing from noncopyable, but this is not needed in classes derived from them. For example, cDefaultList is noncopyable, so cModule, cCompoundModule and cSimpleModule no longer need to redefine dup().
